Name: Brandy Alexander
Preparation: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

Name: Americano
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour the Campari and vermouth over ice into glass, add a splash of soda water and garnish with half orange slice.

Name: Angel Face
Preparation: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass.

Name: Aviation
Preparation: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

Name: B-52
Primary alcohol by volume:
Coffee liqueur
Irish cream
Orange-flavored liqueur
Ingredients: 2 cl (1 part) Irish Cream (Baileys Irish Cream)
Preparation: Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

Name: Bacardi cocktail
Preparation: Shake together with ice. Strain into glass and serve

Name: Bellini
Notes: Traditionally a Bellini uses white peaches for the fruit.
Preparation: Pour peach purée into chilled flute, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.

Name: Between the Sheets
Preparation: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes, shake, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Black Russian
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour the ingredients into an old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Name: Bloody Mary
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Add dashes of Worcestershire Sauce, Tabasco, salt and pepper into highball glass, then pour all ingredients into highball with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Name: Bramble
Preparation: Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.

Name: Caipirinha
Notes: A wide variety of fresh fruits can be used in place of lime. In the absence of cachaça, vodka can be used, making a caipiroska.[1]
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Ingredients: Half a lime cut into 4 wedges
Preparation: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with crushed ice and add the Cachaça.

Name: Casino
Preparation: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

Name: Clover Club Cocktail
Preparation: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

Name: Cosmopolitan
Notes: The drink should be a frothy bright pink color
Preparation: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

Name: Cuba Libre
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Name: Daiquiri
Preparation: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Dark 'N' Stormy
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

Name: Derby
Preparation: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

Name: Espresso Martini
Ingredients: Sugar syrup (according to individual preference of sweetness)
Preparation: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass

Name: French 75
Preparation: Combine Cognac, syrup, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

Name: French Connection
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Name: French Martini
Preparation: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: The Godfather
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

Name: Golden Dream
Preparation: Shake with cracked ice. Strain into glass and serve.

Name: Grasshopper
Primary alcohol by volume:
Crème de cacao
Crème de menthe
Preparation: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Harvey Wallbanger
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top. Garnish and serve.

Name: Horse's Neck
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

Name: John Collins
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

Name: Kamikaze
Preparation: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

Name: Kir
Notes: A recipe can be found at the International Bartenders Association website.
Preparation: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.

Name: Long Island Iced Tea
Primary alcohol by volume:
Gin
Tequila
Vodka
Rum
Triple sec
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon spiral. Serve with straw. [1]

Name: Mai Tai
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Standard garnish: pineapple spear, mint leaves and lime peel
Preparation: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.

Name: Manhattan
Preparation: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

Name: Margarita
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Take care to moisten only the outer rim and sprinkle the salt on it. The salt should present to the lips of the imbiber and never mix into the cocktail. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass.

Name: Dry Martini
Preparation: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

Name: Mary Pickford
Preparation: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

Name: Mimosa
Preparation: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

Name: Mojito
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Standard garnish: sprig of mint (Yerba buena in the original recipe), lemon slice
Preparation: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish and serve with straw.

Name: Monkey Gland
Preparation: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Name: Spritz Veneziano
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

Name: Negroni (cocktail)
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

Name: Old Fashioned
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation:
Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water.
Muddle until dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.
Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.

Name: Paradise
Preparation: Shake together over ice. Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

Name: Pisco sour
Preparation: Vigorously shake and strain contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then pour into glass and garnish with bitters.[1]

Name: Planter's Punch
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, "on top". Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple.

Name: Porto Flip
Preparation: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve

Name: Rose
Preparation: Shake together in a cocktail shaker, then strain into chilled glass. Garnish and serve.

Name: Rusty Nail
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour all ingredients directly into old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish with a lemon twist. Serve.

Name: Sazerac
Notes: Note: The original recipe changed in the latter part of the 19th century. Rye whiskey was substituted when Cognac became difficult to obtain.[2]
Preparation:
Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside.
Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.[1]

Name: Screwdriver
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

Name: Sea Breeze
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

Name: Sex on the Beach
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with orange slice.

Name: Sidecar
Preparation: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

Name: Singapore Sling
Preparation: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into highball glass. Garnish with pineapple and cocktail cherry.

Name: Sours
Alcohol common in this class of cocktail:
Gin
Bourbon whiskey
Brandy
Pisco
Rum
Amaretto

Name: Stinger
Preparation: Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass. May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.

Name: Tequila Sunrise
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Preparation: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice. Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Stir gently to create the sunrise effect. Garnish and serve.

Name: Tuxedo
Preparation: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

Name: Vesper
Preparation: Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep goblet and garnish with a thin slice of lemon peel.

Name: Whiskey sour
Notes: If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.
Served: On the rocks; poured over ice
Standard garnish: Maraschino cherry and half Orange slice
Preparation: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

Name: Yellow Bird
Preparation: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass
